item.title: Does God Exist?
item.description: Photo by Sakshi Shail on Unsplash Introduction Many of us are familiar with Nietzsche’s famous words “God is dead, and we have killed him”, meaning that following the European period known as the Enlightenment, rational and scientific thinking had essentially uprooted the need to believe in the words brought by the Prophets. However, he and the Europeans were quite late to the party. If we go back more than two and a half millennia we will find that a different type of Enlightenment also had the effect of killing the notion of God.
